dt: {bc}to praise oneself extravagantly in speech {bc}speak of oneself with excessive pride
{bc}to speak of or assert with excessive pride

dt.t: He liked to {wi}boast{/wi} that he was the richest man in town.

dt: {bc}to possess and often call attention to (something that is a source of pride)

dt.t: a room {wi}boasting{/wi} no more than a desk and a chair

pt: {sc}boast{/sc} {sc}brag{/sc} {sc}vaunt{/sc} {sc}crow{/sc} mean to express pride in oneself or one's accomplishments. {sc}boast{/sc} often suggests ostentation and exaggeration
, but it may imply a claiming with proper and justifiable pride.

pt.t: the town {it}boasts{/it} one of the best museums in the area

pt: {sc}brag{/sc} suggests crudity and artlessness in glorifying oneself.
{sc}vaunt{/sc} usually connotes more pomp and bombast than {sc}boast{/sc} and less crudity or naïveté than {sc}brag{/sc}.
{sc}crow{/sc} usually implies exultant boasting or bragging.

shortdef: to praise oneself extravagantly in speech : speak of oneself with excessive pride
to speak of or assert with excessive pride

dt: {bc}to shape (stone) roughly in sculpture and stonecutting as a preliminary to finer work
